title: Unzipped post mentioned on news site of Belgian national television
content:
A while ago I wrote a post on Unzipped analysing the design and typography of the Flemish poster campaign for the current European and regional elections, _[The typography of politics](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018112959/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=384)._

To my surprise I learned yesterday that this post has made its way -- via the Facebook profile of Geert Lambert, head of the SLP party -- to [www.deredactie.be](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018112959/http:/www.deredactie.be/ "www.deredactie.be"), the news site of the Belgian national television. Their translation is dodgy and they misunderstood some details, but it still nice to see a focus on typography in the mainstream press. :)

[SLP have already won the elections…](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018112959/http:/www.deredactie.be/cm/vrtnieuws/ookdatnog/1.534657)
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: BTW I do not endorse the SLP, nor do I have anything to do with that politician picking up the story on his Facebook page. Just to clarify… ;)

OK, now this is starting to freak me out. This story was also picked up by the newspaper [Het Nieuwsblad](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018112959/http:/www.nieuwsblad.be/Article/Detail.aspx?ArticleID=GDE2APE08), and regional television station [RTV](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018112959/http:/www.rtv.be/intro.php) requested the text (dunno what they will do with it). What’s next?

It just goes to show that politicians will use any means to make their opponents look bad--even in Belgium!

ChrisL

Chris

My dad's dictum, Politicians are like diapers... full of crap and need to be changed regularly : )
